text: Stairs and handrails match approved shop drawings and specifications
All components properly labeled for assembly (stringers, treads, landings, railings)
Surface finish verified (galvanized, primed, powder-coated, stainless, etc.)
Stringers fabricated to correct rise/run and dimensions
Tread and riser spacing consistent and within building code tolerance
Welds continuous and smooth; cut edges deburred
Units installed at correct elevation and orientation per drawings
Anchors and supports correctly sized, torqued, and embedded
Handrail height, spacing, and returns per code and shop drawings
Guardrails and pickets installed securely and meet code spacing (e.g., < 4")
Anti-slip nosing or coating applied to treads
Exposed ends ground smooth; no sharp projections
Site coating touch-ups completed after welds/handling
Final inspection approved by QA/QC and safety officer

id: • NBC Part 3 and 9 – Stair and Guard Requirements
• CSA S157 / CSA W59 – Steel Connections and Welding
